title: Sprites - Threejs
content: This was made during the start of my two months off, I aimed to just see what I could animate with threejs and wanted to understand more about sprites and using them as textures.

title: Gradient Color Changer
content: After reading up on shaders and using them with threejs, I wanted to experiment with something not to difficult to get started with. For this experiment I focused on the fragment shader and how to create a gradient and then how to change it dynamically.

title: Raindow Spinner
content: After playing around with making linear gradients with shaders I tried to make a radial gradient experimenting while also playing with colors. Learning how to write a function in the shaders and also how to convert hsb to rgb.

title: Displacement Shader
content: Trying to experiment with the vertex shader and how to animate an object. This was a little confusing to me at first, also ran into some problems with holes in my geometry after getting the animation to work.

title: POSTRENDERING EFFECT
content: Experimenting with adding a built in threejs postrendering effect to my scene. While also adding and deleting geometry from a scene.

title: Abstract Animations
content: Trying to understand vertex shaders more and practice animating and distorting shapes.

title: Clocks
content: Something I created while working alongside Nicci Hurwitz at Google Creative Lab Sydney. This is one of the first things I had ever created and was proud of. At the time I was very new to creative coding and had very little experience with JS or programming in general. After being in a meeting and hearing Nicc's idea I was puzzled at how it was even possible. However after 30minutes of planning and deconstructing the problem I had a plan on how to make it and after a few hours of reading up on Angular I had a working prototype. I'm proud of this experiment because I saw how simple a complex problem could be, this experiment was built using just CSS and Angular.

title: Oceans
content: Photocrapper was designed as a simple app where you could upload images of your choice where you could follow friends and view their images. The goal with this app was to be a learning experience for me to understand and enhance my programming skills. I aimed to understand how to create a simple app like instagram without the cool filters. This app was created as my first project and was a great learning experience, I intend on taking this further and adding some filters and sharing features.

title: Orb
content: This was something I created in 2012 as a test for what was possible to do in After Effects, and how to create a 3D particle feel without using any 3D software at all. It uses a set of images overlayed on each other and inimated effects to give the illussion of a 3D particle effect.
